definition[0]: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someoneâ€™s body by using a special needle
example[0]: The drug is injected directly into the base of the spine.
example[1]: I have to inject myself with insulin.
definition[1]: to improve something by adding excitement, interest etc to it
example[2]: Traditional handbag makers are injecting more fun into their designs.
example[3]: A market building can inject new life into an area.
definition[2]: to provide more money, equipment etc for something
example[4]: They need to inject more money into sports facilities.
definition[3]: to provide money, ideas, skills etc for an organization or an activity, to make it perform better or to stop it from failing
example[5]: This was an opportunity to inject some life into the campaign.
example[6]: It injected new capital into the company.
